skshapelet.shapelet.filehelper.write_shapelets_to_csv(dataset_name, model_id, distinct_class, shapelets)[source]¶

A simple function to save the shapelets obtained in csv format

dataset_name: string

The name of the dataset

shapelets: array-like

The shapelets obtained for a dataset

distinct_class: array-like

The distinct class of shapelets

skshapelet.shapelet.shapelet module¶

class skshapelet.shapelet.shapelet.Shapelet(start_pos, length, id=0, info_gain=None, data=None, label=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The class to describe shapelet behaviours.

Attributes:
start_pos: int

The index of the start position.

length: int

The length of the shapelet.

id: int, optional

The index of the time series dataset.

info_gain: int, optional

The information gain of the shapelet.

data: ndarray, optional

Mean array or z-score array of the shapelet.

is_intersection(other)[source]¶

Find whether these 2 shapelets have overlapped. Args:

other: Shapelet

Another shapelet.

Returns:
output: Bool

The check result.

is_self(other)[source]¶
is_similar(other)[source]¶

Find whether these 2 shapelets are similar. Args:

other: Shapelet

Another shapelet.

Returns:
output: Bool

The check result.

skshapelet.shapelet.shapelet_set module¶

class skshapelet.shapelet.shapelet_set.ShapeletSet[source]¶

Bases: object

The class to describe ShapeletSet behaviours. To save time, we sort the list each time we insert a shapelet.

Attributes:
shapelets: list

A list to store the acceptable shapelet.

skshapelet.shapelet.shapelet_transform module¶

class skshapelet.shapelet.shapelet_transform.BinaryShapeletTransform(dataset_name, model_id, min_shapelet_length=3, max_shapelet_length=inf, max_shapelets_to_store_per_class=200, time_transform_in_mins=None, num_candidates_to_sample_per_case=None, random_seed=None)[source]¶

Bases: sktime.transformations.base._PanelToTabularTransformer

BinaryShapeletTransform. This implementation is based on sktime.

Attributes:
min_shapelet_length: int, optional

The best so far distance.

max_shapelet_length: int, optional

The maximum length of the shapelet.

max_shapelets_to_store_per_class: int, optional

The maximum shapelet size for each class.

time_transform_in_mins: int, optional

The maximum transformation time.

num_candidates_to_sample_per_case: int, optional

The maximum candidates for each time series.

random_seed: int, optional

The random seed.

static discard_if_needed(stack, num_max_size)[source]¶
static distance_scan(start, end, other_ts, shapelet_len, shapelet_data, is_univariate)[source]¶

Scan distance between 2 time series.

Attributes:
start: Shapelet

Start position.

end: ndarray

End position.

other_ts: ndarray

The another time series.

shapelet_len: int

The length of the shapelet

shapelet_data: ndarray

The information that shapelet carries with.

is_univariate: bool

The property of this dataset.

Returns:
bsf_dist: float

Return the shortest distance.

static find_distance(shapelet, other_ts, is_univariate, shapelet_data)[source]¶

Find the shortest distance. The origin point is where the shapelet exactly is. We will scan left first and then scan right.

Attributes:
shapelet: Shapelet

The current candidate.

other_ts: ndarray

The another time series.

is_univariate: bool

The property of this dataset.

shapelet_data: ndarray

The information that shapelet carries.

Returns:
output: float

Return the shortest distance.

fit(X, y=None)[source]¶

Fit transformer to X and y.

By default, fit is empty. Fittable transformations overwrite fit method.

ZTimeSeries

Data to be transformed

XTimeSeries, optional (default=None)

Extra data

self : a fitted instance of the estimator

static generate_candidates_by_cache(X_len, min_len, max_len)[source]¶

Generate candidates one time, use it forever:)

Attributes:
X_len: int

The length of current time series.

min_len: int

The minimum length.

max_len: int

The maximum length.

Returns:
output: list

Contain all possible candidates with a specific length range.

get_shapelets()[source]¶
static random_shapelet_selection(candidates, num_require_per_case, random_state)[source]¶

Select shapelet by random state.

Attributes:
candidates: list

The list of all possible candidates.

num_require_per_case: int

The required number of each time series.

random_state: RandomState

The instance of RandomState.

Returns:
output: list

Return a list of selected candidates.

static random_shuffle_class_case_policy(y, random_state, distinct_class)[source]¶

Suffle the class case by random state.

Attributes:
y: ndarray

The numpy array.

random_state: RandomState

The instance of RandomState.

distinct_class: list

A list contains all distinct class labels.

Returns:
num_ins_per_class: int

The number of instance in each class.

ts_order: list

The order of the time series.

static reduce_if_needed(shapelets, num_max_size)[source]¶
static remove_self_similar_shapelets(shapelets)[source]¶

Remove self similar shapelets.

Attributes:
shapelets: list

The list of Shapelet instances.

Returns:
distinct_shapelets: list

Return a list that contains distinct Shapelet instances.

transform(X, y=None)[source]¶

Transform a set of data into distances to each extracted shapelet. Test dataset should be transformed as a distance matrix.

Args:
x: pandas DataFrame

The input dataframe to transform

y: pandas DataFrame or None, optional

The test class label array.

Returns:
output: pandas DataFrame

The transformed dataframe in tabular format.

static update_ig_threshold(threshold, stack, label)[source]¶

Update the information gain threshold if needed.

Attributes:
threshold: float

The baseline of the information gain.

stack: list

The list stores shapelets.

label: int

The label of the current class.

Returns:
threshold: float

Return new information gain threshold.
